bibl.title: K. Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minhu
كتاب كنه ما لا بد للمريد منه
bibl.incipit: al-ḥamdu lillāh rabb al-ʿalamīn wa-ʿāqibuhu lil-muttaqīn wa-ṣallā Allāh ʿalā sayyidinā Muḥammad
bibl.author: Ibn al-ʿArabī

noteGrp.note: Advice to the student starting out on the Sufi path.

bibl.note: A much copied work (OY lists 35 mss.), verified by three historic mss. The best are Shehit Ali 1341 (724H taken from an original in the hand of IA), Manisa 1183 (650H, written by a direct student of IA’s), and Veliyuddin 51 (762H and copied from IA’s original). According to OY, it was written 601H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that he has confused the place of copying with the place of writing. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyyudin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.) Further mss identified by JC: Bankipore ms 955/1 (778H), said to be transcribed from autograph; KÖPRÜLÜ Fazıl Ahmed Pş 53, ff. 109-163

note.p: Dating Denis and Jane: “Osman Yahia maintains that the work was composed in Mosul in 601, and he gives as his source not Veliyuddin 51 but a reference in Brockelmann, who lists other manuscripts, outside Turkey, which we have not yet inspected.” This could make sense given qas_ilah was composed in Mosul on this date in the same collection...
